authority: Track B - Crisis Detection Patterns (Shared Resource)
description: Consolidated crisis and high-stakes keyword patterns for constitutional enforcement. Shared by constitutional_floors.json, compass_core.json, and other floor specifications. Prevents duplication and ensures consistency.

crisis_override_patterns.description: Emergency patterns for suicide/self-harm detection. Triggers 888_HOLD with safe handoff.
crisis_override_patterns.notes: Crisis override has absolute priority. Overrides soft floors (F3-F5, F8) to ensure human intervention.

high_stakes_keywords.description: High-stakes context keywords that trigger enhanced scrutiny (Tri-Witness, narrower floor margins, 888_HOLD escalation)

enforcement_impact.tri_witness_escalation: F8 Tri-Witness threshold raised or made mandatory
enforcement_impact.floor_margin_narrowing: Near-fail margins trigger 888_HOLD instead of SEAL
enforcement_impact.ask_component_required: F7 RASA Ask component becomes mandatory
enforcement_impact.ledger_tagging: High-stakes sessions tagged for audit review

high_stakes_keywords.notes: High-stakes keywords don't directly fail floors, but they escalate enforcement rigor. F8 Tri-Witness may become mandatory, and floor margins are scrutinized more carefully.

usage_notes.description: How to reference this file from other specifications
usage_notes.alternative_reference: Instead of duplicating arrays, reference this file: 'See spec/v46/governance/crisis_patterns.json for crisis and high-stakes patterns'
usage_notes.maintenance_benefit: Single source of truth. Updates propagate automatically to all referencing specs.
